meanings.definition: The pair of wings on an insect that are attached to the hindmost segment of the thorax.
meanings.sent1: The hindwings of the butterfly help it glide gracefully through the air.
meanings.sent2: The dragonfly's hindwings are larger than its forewings.
meanings.sent3: The cricket decided to take a break and sunbathe its hindwings.
meanings.sent4: As the bee buzzed away, its hindwings shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The hindwings of the beetle were iridescent, reflecting all the colors of the rainbow.

meanings.definition: The wings on the back half of a bird's body.
meanings.sent1: The eagle spread its hindwings wide as it soared high above the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The owl's hindwings allowed it to fly silently through the night.
meanings.sent3: The pigeon flapped its hindwings enthusiastically, trying to impress its mate.
meanings.sent4: The hawk's hindwings caught the warm updraft, lifting it effortlessly into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The swan's hindwings beat rhythmically, propelling it gracefully across the water.
